00023   struct RecList
00024   {
00025     virtual void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id) = 0;
00026     virtual int getSize() = 0;
00027     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const = 0;
00028 
00029     static std::string toLower (const std::string& name)
00030     {
00031         std::string lowerCase;
00032 
00033         std::transform (name.begin(), name.end(), std::back_inserter (lowerCase),
00034             (int(*)(int)) std::tolower);
00035 
00036         return lowerCase;
00037     }
00038   };

00042   template <typename X>
00043   struct RecListT : RecList
00044   {
00045     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00046 
00047     MapType list;
00048 
00049     // Load one object of this type
00050     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00051     {
00052       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00053       list[id2].load(esm);
00054     }
00055 
00056     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00057     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00058     {
00059         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00060 
00061         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00062 
00063         if (iter == list.end())
00064             return NULL;
00065 
00066         return &iter->second;
00067     }
00068 
00069     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00070     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00071     {
00072         const X *object = search (id);
00073 
00074         if (!object)
00075             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00076 
00077         return object;
00078     }
00079 
00080     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00081 
00082     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00083     {
00084         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00085             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00086     }
00087   };

00188   /* Land textures are indexed by an integer number
00189    */
00190   struct LTexList : RecList
00191   {
00192     // TODO: For multiple ESM/ESP files we need one list per file.
00193     std::vector<LandTexture> ltex;
00194     int count;
00195 
00196     LTexList() : count(0)
00197     {
00198       // More than enough to hold Morrowind.esm.
00199       ltex.reserve(128);
00200     }
00201 
00202     int getSize() { return count; }
00203 
00204     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00205 
00206     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00207     {
00208       LandTexture lt;
00209       lt.load(esm);
00210       lt.id = id;
00211 
00212       // Make sure we have room for the structure
00213       if(lt.index + 1 > (int)ltex.size())
00214         ltex.resize(lt.index+1);
00215 
00216       // Store it
00217       ltex[lt.index] = lt;
00218     }
00219   };

00221   /* Landscapes are indexed by the X,Y coordinates of the exterior
00222      cell they belong to.
00223    */
00224   struct LandList : RecList
00225   {
00226     // Map containing all landscapes
00227     typedef std::map<int, Land*> LandsCol;
00228     typedef std::map<int, LandsCol> Lands;
00229     Lands lands;
00230 
00231     int count;
00232     LandList() : count(0) {}
00233     int getSize() { return count; }
00234 
00235     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00236 
00237     // Find land for the given coordinates. Return null if no data.
00238     const Land *search(int x, int y) const
00239     {
00240       Lands::const_iterator it = lands.find(x);
00241       if(it==lands.end())
00242         return NULL;
00243 
00244       LandsCol::const_iterator it2 = it->second.find(y);
00245       if(it2 == it->second.end())
00246         return NULL;
00247 
00248       return it2->second;
00249     }
00250 
00251     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00252     {
00253       count++;
00254 
00255       // Create the structure and load it. This actually skips the
00256       // landscape data and remembers the file position for later.
00257       Land *land = new Land;
00258       land->load(esm);
00259 
00260       // Store the structure
00261       lands[land->X][land->Y] = land;
00262     }
00263   };

00265     struct ciLessBoost : std::binary_function<std::string, std::string, bool>
00266 {
00267     bool operator() (const std::string & s1, const std::string & s2) const {
00268                                                //case insensitive version of is_less
00269         return lexicographical_compare(s1, s2, is_iless());
00270     }
00271 };

00274   // Cells aren't simply indexed by name. Exterior cells are treated
00275   // separately.
00276   // TODO: case handling (cell names are case-insensitive, but they are also showen to the
00277   // player, so we can't simply smash case.
00278   struct CellList : RecList
00279   {
00280     // Total cell count. Used for statistics.
00281     int count;
00282     CellList() : count(0) {}
00283     int getSize() { return count; }
00284 
00285     // List of interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00286     typedef std::map<std::string,ESM::Cell*, ciLessBoost> IntCells;
00287     IntCells intCells;
00288 
00289     // List of exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00290     typedef std::map<int, ESM::Cell*> ExtCellsCol;
00291     typedef std::map<int, ExtCellsCol> ExtCells;
00292     ExtCells extCells;
00293 
00294     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00295     {
00296         for (IntCells::const_iterator iter (intCells.begin()); iter!=intCells.end(); ++iter)
00297             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00298     }
00299 
00300     ~CellList()
00301     {
00302       for (IntCells::iterator it = intCells.begin(); it!=intCells.end(); ++it)
00303         delete it->second;
00304 
00305       for (ExtCells::iterator it = extCells.begin(); it!=extCells.end(); ++it)
00306       {
00307         ExtCellsCol& col = it->second;
00308         for (ExtCellsCol::iterator it = col.begin(); it!=col.end(); ++it)
00309         {
00310           delete it->second;
00311         }
00312       }
00313     }
00314 
00315 
00316     const ESM::Cell* findInt(const std::string &id) const
00317     {
00318       IntCells::const_iterator it = intCells.find(id);
00319 
00320       if(it == intCells.end())
00321         return NULL;
00322 
00323       return it->second;
00324     }
00325 
00326     const ESM::Cell *searchExt (int x, int y) const
00327     {
00328         ExtCells::const_iterator it = extCells.find (x);
00329 
00330         if (it==extCells.end())
00331             return 0;
00332 
00333         ExtCellsCol::const_iterator it2 = it->second.find (y);
00334 
00335         if (it2 == it->second.end())
00336             return 0;
00337 
00338         return it2->second;
00339     }
00340 
00341     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByName (const std::string& id) const
00342     {
00343         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00344         {
00345             const ExtCellsCol& column = iter->second;
00346             for (ExtCellsCol::const_iterator iter = column.begin(); iter!=column.end(); ++iter)
00347             {
00348                 if ( toLower(iter->second->name) == toLower(id))
00349                     return iter->second;
00350             }
00351         }
00352 
00353         return 0;
00354     }
00355 
00356     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByRegion (const std::string& id) const
00357     {
00358         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00359 
00360         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00361         {
00362             const ExtCellsCol& column = iter->second;
00363             for (ExtCellsCol::const_iterator iter = column.begin(); iter!=column.end(); ++iter)
00364             {
00365                 if (toLower (iter->second->region)==id)
00366                     return iter->second;
00367             }
00368         }
00369 
00370         return 0;
00371     }
00372 
00373     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00374     {
00375       count++;
00376 
00377       // All cells have a name record, even nameless exterior cells.
00378       ESM::Cell *cell = new ESM::Cell;
00379       cell->name = id;
00380 
00381       // The cell itself takes care of all the hairy details
00382       cell->load(esm);
00383 
00384       if(cell->data.flags & ESM::Cell::Interior)
00385         {
00386           // Store interior cell by name
00387           intCells[id] = cell;
00388         }
00389       else
00390         {
00391           // Store exterior cells by grid position
00392           extCells[cell->data.gridX][cell->data.gridY] = cell;
00393         }
00394     }
00395   };

00397   template <typename X>
00398   struct ScriptListT : RecList
00399   {
00400     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00401 
00402     MapType list;
00403 
00404     // Load one object of this type
00405     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00406     {
00407       X ref;
00408       ref.load (esm);
00409 
00410       std::string realId = toLower (ref.data.name.toString());
00411 
00412       std::swap (list[realId], ref);
00413     }
00414 
00415     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00416     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00417     {
00418         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00419 
00420         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00421 
00422         if (iter == list.end())
00423             return NULL;
00424 
00425         return &iter->second;
00426     }
00427 
00428     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00429     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00430     {
00431         const X *object = search (id);
00432 
00433         if (!object)
00434             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00435 
00436         return object;
00437     }
00438 
00439     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00440 
00441     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00442     {
00443         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00444             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00445     }
00446   };

00448   template <typename X>
00449   struct IndexListT
00450   {
00451         typedef std::map<int, X> MapType;
00452 
00453         MapType list;
00454 
00455         void load(ESMReader &esm)
00456         {
00457             X ref;
00458             ref.load (esm);
00459             int index = ref.index;
00460             list[index] = ref;
00461         }
00462 
00463         int getSize()
00464         {
00465             return list.size();
00466         }
00467 
00468         virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00469 
00470         // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00471         const X* search (int id) const
00472         {
00473             typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id);
00474 
00475             if (iter == list.end())
00476                 return NULL;
00477 
00478             return &iter->second;
00479         }
00480 
00481         // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00482         const X* find (int id) const
00483         {
00484             const X *object = search (id);
00485 
00486             if (!object)
00487             {
00488                 std::ostringstream error;
00489                 error << "object " << id << " not found";
00490                 throw std::runtime_error (error.str());
00491             }
00492 
00493             return object;
00494         }
00495   };
